name: places/ChIJ-Uqs511ZwokRXGryze5zDMY
formattedAddress: 731 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 731 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
What a great find! My go to in this area is Birch which is a couple of blocks down but decided to try this spot and am so glad I did! It's part of the capital one cafe which is basically this Verve location in combination with a capital one banking outpost. Not sure if there are any other parts to it that I missed.

I really loved the seating concept, reminded me of a really nice airport lounge. Lots of spaces that can double up as work stations. It's also designed really nicely to make it appear very roomy unlike a lot of cafes in New York that a so cramped.

I hate one of the winter specials - a cardamom latte. It was delicious and something I really appreciated was that it was actually piping hot when I got it, which was perfect for a chilly day. Most times I feel like lattes are lukewarm when you get them and tepid by the time you're less than halfway through. So this was a big W for Verve in my book! They also had signs up saying capital one card members get 50% off which is a phenomenal deal for such good coffee!

Definitely going to be back

originalText.text: Great Coffee, and great staff. The staff are always very nice to me, and will always provide good service and help you if anything goes wrong. You get half off with the capital one card, which is a huge plus! I recommend going here! I am a regular at this place and I will continue to be. Great place!

text.text: Great Coffee, and great staff. The staff are always very nice to me, and will always provide good service and help you if anything goes wrong. You get half off with the capital one card, which is a huge plus! I recommend going here! I am a regular at this place and I will continue to be. Great place!

originalText.text:
CapitalOne card users get HALF OFF?! I don’t have a one and def applied for one…
I tried their pumpkin latte and it was on the sweeter side but delicious. The inside space is very open and welcoming. There’s plenty of places to post up to work and relax.

I tried their pumpkin latte and it was on the sweeter side but delicious. The inside space is very open and welcoming. There’s plenty of places to post up to work and relax.

originalText.text: Stopped here for the first time with a friend around 3:30pm on Wednesday. The cafe itself is beautiful. Unfortunately, they were completely out of ALL brewed coffee and also stated they couldn’t make tea. They were not making more. The cashier was very short with us, I’m sure having to tell customers that you are out of everything isn’t easy. I’m not sure what they were planning to do until they closed, which is supposedly at 7pm according to their posted hours. I would recommend they close the cafe if they run out of any available drinks, as I don’t think it’s fair for the people staffing the cafe or for customers.

originalText.text: Haven't gotten any food there yet, but drinks are great, especially with this 50% price in Manhattan as a capital one card holder. Love the concept. It's chill. There's security there to keep out the riff raff. Bathroom is accessible with code.
